Helper function to select columns typically used in an ACS table

Source: R/utils.R
select_acs_cols.Rd

Helper function to select columns typically used in an ACS table

Usage

select_acs_cols(
  data,
  name_col = "name",
  column_title_col = "column_title",
  est_cols = c("estimate", "moe"),
  perc_est_cols = c("perc_estimate", "perc_moe"),
  .drop_denominator = TRUE,
  ...
)

Arguments

data

Input data table

obj:<data.frame>|obj:<tbl_df> // required

A data.frame object or a tibble (tbl_df).

name_col, column_title_col, est_cols, perc_est_cols

ACS data column names to select using tidyselect::any_of(). Set any parameter to NULL to avoid selecting columns.

.drop_denominator

If TRUE (default), drop all columns that start with the text "denominator".

...

Additional parameters passed to dplyr::select()
